alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Elk; Labette; Montgomery (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 9:56AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Elk, Labette, Montgomery and northeastern Chautauqua Counties through 1100 AM CDT... At 956 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Independence, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parsons, Coffeyville, Independence, Cherryvale, Oswego, Chetopa, Altamont, Edna, Dearing, Mound Valley, Longton, Elk City, Tyro, Liberty, Elk Falls, Havana, Bolton, Sycamore, Bartlett and Labette. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
